basic.description: An introduction to graph theory, one of the central disciplines of discrete mathematics. Topics include: graphs and subgraphs, trees, bond and cycle spaces, connectivity, Euler tours and Hamiltonian cycles, matchings, independent sets, cliques and networks (if time permits).  (Offered jointly with MATH-401*.)  Three term-hours, fall; lectures.
basic.subject: MATH
basic.title: Graph Theory
